card.description: This dataset is a list of exoplanets, which are planets orbiting other stars. With this data, it's possible to estimate the size of an exoplanet as well as other characteristics.

context.potentialUses: Estimate the size or mass of an exoplanet based on the size, age or other aspects of the star it orbits.
context.potentialMisuses: Trying to make guesses as to whether a planet could support life.

fields.description: The name of the start this exoplanet is orbiting.
Number of stars in the exoplanet's system.
Number of planets in the exoplanet's system.
The year this exoplanet was discovered.
How long it takes for this planet to make a complete orbit around its host star, measured in earth days.
The relative size of this exoplanet in comparison to earth.
The relative mass of this exoplanet in comparison to earth.
The temperature of the host star in kelvin.
The relative size of the host star in comparison to the sun.
The relative mass of the host star in comparison to the sun.

fields.id: Star age in billions of years
fields.description: The age of the host star.
